snippet: Prosecutors wanted to keep Facebook from telling users about 15 subpoenas of their data. But a judge refused, saying the need for them was not specific enough.
abstract: James Orenstein, federal judge in Brooklyn, rules prosecutors cannot force Facebook to keep from telling its customers about 15 grand-jury subpoenas of their data.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors wanted to keep Facebook from telling users about 15 subpoenas of their data. But a judge refused, saying the need for them was not specific enough.

headline.main: Brooklyn Judge Will Not Force Facebook’s Silence on Subpoenas
headline.print_headline: Judge Will Not Force Facebook’s Silence on Subpoenas
